Sunny Days- When Holly says it hot out...
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher Advance 2 Archive (GameBoy Advance): Raising Methods: Sunny Days- When Holly says it hot out...
By Darkstar on Monday, December 16, 2002 - 12:32 am:

Hey guys I just noticed a tiny thing with the game that's kind of cool. During the summer Holly will say she is really hot and she's sweating and when that happens she goes for a jog and that you should try it. I at first thought nothing of it but then I noticed she said it every summer. So I thought okay what training is like jogging. So I tried sidestepping for life training. Instead of my normal 11 point stat gain I got a 25 point stat gain. I haven't seen it do that for any of the other training drills. Just thought you guys might find this handy for a quick life boost even on monsters you aren't really training in life.

By Thorr on Monday, December 16, 2002 - 10:30 am:

Of course, you could always just go Jogging, like she says. (Roadwork)

-Thorr

By Darkstar on Monday, December 16, 2002 - 10:43 am:

So that's what Roadwork is. I hadn't done it yet because I haven't been workin on coaches really.

By Mewger on Tuesday, January 14, 2003 - 08:31 pm:

I always did Tow when she said that. Increased Lif and Pow gains.

By GoldenBoy on Wednesday, January 15, 2003 - 10:46 am:

The advantage of doing the simple Life drill is a doubled gain for less fatigue. It really pays off with younger monsters too, since the chances for a great seem higher.

Since I have great coaches, My gain on a hard drill would be 30 with or without the sun (on most monsters) so the light drill will only pay off if I'm near the end of that training cycle.

By GoldenBoy on Thursday, January 30, 2003 - 12:23 pm:

This would be where the trait Sunshine could come
in handy. A monster not good at Life drills would
benefit a lot from gaining double life.
